page.title: 06ENERGY-GAS-WESTFIELD POINT
page.content:
Some of the remaining land may be needed in the future but,for the time being,part will be landscaped and the rest returned to farming.
At the terminal the gas will first be passed through a series of pipes called slug-catchers .The pipes are there to catch slugs of oily liquid known as condensate.They will be piped to storage tanks at Barrow docks and will then be removed by ship.
Other processing at the terminal will include drying the gas by refrideration and adding chemicals to give it a gassy smell.Natural gas, which is mostly methane has no natural smell of its own.Finally the quality of the gas,including temperature and pressure,will be checked before the gas is passed to the onshore pipeline.
